com.example.moelkky
Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.example.moelkky.GameScreen

public class GameScreen
extends Activity

GameScreen holds all the logic for a game of Mölkky. Starts by showing the randomized order of players, after that it shows player whose turn it currently is, with buttons to add result of throw made, and optional button to show current scores in new activity. A throw button must be pressed for next players turn to begin. Ending game with back button prompts user confirmation

Author:
Aleksi Majander

Method Summary
private  void callScoreScreen()
          Calls ScoreScreen activity Method creates new Intent, adds the list of players and scores and starts activity activity from ScoreBoard.
private  void gameWon()
          Dialog showing winning player Method creates AlertDialog that tells the name of winning Player and gives choices to either show final scores, or end the game
private  void newThrow(int result)
          Updates current player with result of throw made Method is called when player presses the button corresponding his last throws result.
private  void nextPlayer()
          Method changes the next player in game to be the current player Method is called when one player finishes his turn, it checks if there are still other players in game, if so it goes recursively trough the gameOrder list to find next player still in game and updates UI to correspond with the player in question
 void onBackPressed()
          Adds confirmation to back key press Method overrides the default BACK key press to prompt alert dialog requiring user confirmation for exit
 void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
           
private  Player[] randomGameOrder(Player[] currentOrder)
          Method randomizes the order in given Player[] array
private  void showGameOrder()
          Dialog showing the order of players Method creates AlertDialog to show the generated order in which players will play the game

          Method updates UI to correspond with the player whose turn it is to throw

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

updateUI

private void updateUI()
Method updates UI to correspond with the player whose turn it is to throw

See Also:
currentPlayer, gameOrder

newThrow

private void newThrow(int result)
Updates current player with result of throw made Method is called when player presses the button corresponding his last throws result. It adds score to scores list and checks if player wins with the throw and either calls gameWon() or nextPlayer()

Parameters:
result - Integer value of last throw player made
See Also:
gameWon(), nextPlayer(), scores, currentPlayer, Player.newThrow(int)

nextPlayer

private void nextPlayer()
Method changes the next player in game to be the current player Method is called when one player finishes his turn, it checks if there are still other players in game, if so it goes recursively trough the gameOrder list to find next player still in game and updates UI to correspond with the player in question

See Also:
updateUI(), gameWon(), playercount, currentPlayer, gameOrder

onBackPressed

public void onBackPressed()
Adds confirmation to back key press Method overrides the default BACK key press to prompt alert dialog requiring user confirmation for exit

callScoreScreen

private void callScoreScreen()
Calls ScoreScreen activity Method creates new Intent, adds the list of players and scores and starts activity activity from ScoreBoard.

See Also:
Scoreboard

randomGameOrder

private Player[] randomGameOrder(Player[] currentOrder)
Method randomizes the order in given Player[] array

Parameters:
currentOrder - Array of Players
Returns:
Array of Players with random order

gameWon

private void gameWon()
Dialog showing winning player Method creates AlertDialog that tells the name of winning Player and gives choices to either show final scores, or end the game

See Also:
callScoreScreen()

showGameOrder

private void showGameOrder()
Dialog showing the order of players Method creates AlertDialog to show the generated order in which players will play the game
